intro: Boechera bodiensis, commonly known as the Sierra Nevada rockcress, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. This species typically grows in rocky or gravelly habitats, often in mountainous regions. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers and has basal leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Boechera bodiensis is known for its ability to thrive in harsh, alpine environments.
